trans-unit.source: Line of business application Phase 4 | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Line of business application Phase 4 | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Create the web servers and load your line of business application on them in Phase 4 of the line of business application in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Create the web servers and load your line of business application on them in Phase 4 of the line of business application in Azure.

trans-unit.source: In this phase of deploying a high availability line of business application in Azure infrastructure services, you build out the web servers and load your line of business application on them.
trans-unit.target: In this phase of deploying a high availability line of business application in Azure infrastructure services, you build out the web servers and load your line of business application on them.

trans-unit.source: You must complete this phase before moving on to <linkText>Phase 5</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: You must complete this phase before moving on to <linkText>Phase 5</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Deploy a high-availability line of business application in Azure</linkText><title></title> for all of the phases.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Deploy a high-availability line of business application in Azure</linkText><title></title> for all of the phases.

trans-unit.source: There are two web server virtual machines, on which you can deploy ASP.NET applications or older applications that can be hosted by Internet Information Services (IIS) 8 in Windows Server 2012 R2.
trans-unit.target: There are two web server virtual machines, on which you can deploy ASP.NET applications or older applications that can be hosted by Internet Information Services (IIS) 8 in Windows Server 2012 R2.

trans-unit.source: First, you configure internal load balancing so that Azure distributes the client traffic to the line of business application evenly among the two web servers. This requires you to specify an internal load balancing instance consisting of a name and its own IP address, assigned from the subnet address space that you assigned to your Azure virtual network. To determine whether an IP address you chose for the internal load balancer is available, use these commands at the Azure PowerShell prompt. Specify the values for the variables and remove the < and > characters.
trans-unit.target: First, you configure internal load balancing so that Azure distributes the client traffic to the line of business application evenly among the two web servers. This requires you to specify an internal load balancing instance consisting of a name and its own IP address, assigned from the subnet address space that you assigned to your Azure virtual network. To determine whether an IP address you chose for the internal load balancer is available, use these commands at the Azure PowerShell prompt. Specify the values for the variables and remove the < and > characters.

trans-unit.source: If the IsAvailable field in the display of the Test-AzureStaticVNetIP command is True, you can use the IP address.
trans-unit.target: If the IsAvailable field in the display of the Test-AzureStaticVNetIP command is True, you can use the IP address.

trans-unit.source: Switch back to the Resource Manager mode of PowerShell with this command.
trans-unit.target: Switch back to the Resource Manager mode of PowerShell with this command.

trans-unit.source: Next, fill in the variables and run the following set of commands:
trans-unit.target: Next, fill in the variables and run the following set of commands:

trans-unit.source: Next, add a DNS address record to your organization's internal DNS infrastructure that resolves the fully qualified domain name of the line of business application (such as lobapp.corp.contoso.com) to the IP address assigned to the internal load balancer (the value of $privIP in the preceding Azure PowerShell command block).
trans-unit.target: Next, add a DNS address record to your organization's internal DNS infrastructure that resolves the fully qualified domain name of the line of business application (such as lobapp.corp.contoso.com) to the IP address assigned to the internal load balancer (the value of $privIP in the preceding Azure PowerShell command block).

trans-unit.source: Next, use the following block of PowerShell commands to create the virtual machines for the two web servers.
trans-unit.target: Next, use the following block of PowerShell commands to create the virtual machines for the two web servers.

trans-unit.source: Note that this PowerShell command set uses values from the following tables:
trans-unit.target: Note that this PowerShell command set uses values from the following tables:

trans-unit.source: Table M, for your virtual machines
trans-unit.target: Table M, for your virtual machines

trans-unit.source: Table V, for your virtual network settings
trans-unit.target: Table V, for your virtual network settings

trans-unit.source: Table S, for your subnet
trans-unit.target: Table S, for your subnet

trans-unit.source: Table ST, for your storage accounts
trans-unit.target: Table ST, for your storage accounts

trans-unit.source: Table A, for your availability sets
trans-unit.target: Table A, for your availability sets

trans-unit.source: Recall that you defined Table M in <linkText>Phase 2</linkText><title></title> and Tables V, S, ST, and A in <linkText>Phase 1</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Recall that you defined Table M in <linkText>Phase 2</linkText><title></title> and Tables V, S, ST, and A in <linkText>Phase 1</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: When you have supplied all the proper values, run the resulting block at the Azure PowerShell prompt.
trans-unit.target: When you have supplied all the proper values, run the resulting block at the Azure PowerShell prompt.

trans-unit.source: Use the remote desktop client of your choice and create a remote desktop connection to each web server virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Use the remote desktop client of your choice and create a remote desktop connection to each web server virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Use its intranet DNS or computer name and the credentials of the local administrator account.
trans-unit.target: Use its intranet DNS or computer name and the credentials of the local administrator account.

trans-unit.source: Next, for each web server virtual machine, join them to the appropriate Active Directory domain with these commands at the Windows PowerShell prompt.
trans-unit.target: Next, for each web server virtual machine, join them to the appropriate Active Directory domain with these commands at the Windows PowerShell prompt.

trans-unit.source: Note that you must supply domain account credentials after entering the Add-Computer command.
trans-unit.target: Note that you must supply domain account credentials after entering the Add-Computer command.

trans-unit.source: After they restart, reconnect to them using an account that has local administrator privileges.
trans-unit.target: After they restart, reconnect to them using an account that has local administrator privileges.

trans-unit.source: Next, for each web server, install and configure IIS.
trans-unit.target: Next, for each web server, install and configure IIS.

trans-unit.source: Run Server Manager, and then click Add roles and features.
trans-unit.target: Run Server Manager, and then click Add roles and features.

trans-unit.source: On the Before you begin page, click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Before you begin page, click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Select installation type page, click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Select installation type page, click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Select destination server page, click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Select destination server page, click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Server roles page, click Web Server (IIS) in the list of Roles.
trans-unit.target: On the Server roles page, click Web Server (IIS) in the list of Roles.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, click Add Features, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, click Add Features, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Select features page, click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Select features page, click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Web Server (IIS) page, click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Web Server (IIS) page, click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Select role services page, select or clear the check boxes for the services you need for your LOB application, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Select role services page, select or clear the check boxes for the services you need for your LOB application, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: 10.On the Confirm installation selections page, click Install.
trans-unit.target: 10.On the Confirm installation selections page, click Install.

trans-unit.source: From a computer on your on-premises network:
trans-unit.target: From a computer on your on-premises network:

trans-unit.source: Add the files for your line of business application to the two web servers.
trans-unit.target: Add the files for your line of business application to the two web servers.

trans-unit.source: Create the databases for your line of business application on the SQL Server cluster.
trans-unit.target: Create the databases for your line of business application on the SQL Server cluster.

trans-unit.source: Test access to your line of business application and its functionality.
trans-unit.target: Test access to your line of business application and its functionality.

trans-unit.source: This diagram is the configuration resulting from the successful completion of this phase.
trans-unit.target: This diagram is the configuration resulting from the successful completion of this phase.

trans-unit.source: To continue with the configuration of this workload, go to <linkText>Phase 5: Create the availability group and add the application databases</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To continue with the configuration of this workload, go to <linkText>Phase 5: Create the availability group and add the application databases</linkText><title></title>.
